steps.title: Wash and moisturize your face to prep your skin for makeup.
steps.content: Wash and moisturize your face to prep your skin for makeup. Wet your face with warm water and apply a gentle cleanser to remove any oil and dirt. Rinse it off and pat your face dry with a towel, then apply a thin layer of moisturizer all over your face. Wait about 10 minutes for your moisturizer to soak in before you start your makeup. [1] X Research source Moisturizing your face will make your skin less oily so your foundation has a matte finish.

steps.title: Apply primer so your foundation goes on well and stays in place.
steps.content: Apply primer so your foundation goes on well and stays in place. [2] X Expert Source Katya Gudaeva Professional Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 April 2019. Dab a pea-sized amount of skin primer onto your fingers and then rub it onto your skin. Pay special attention to the areas of your face that get oily, like your nose, cheeks, and forehead. [3] X Research source Primer helps to close up your pores and creates a solid base for your makeup to sit on top of. [4] X Expert Source Katya Gudaeva Professional Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 April 2019.

steps.title: Use a sponge to pat and blend matte foundation into your skin.
steps.content: Use a sponge to pat and blend matte foundation into your skin. Be sure to use a matte foundation that matches your skin tone. Dab a few dots of foundation onto your cheeks, chin, and forehead. Use a blending sponge or brush to pat the foundation onto your skin in small, circular motions until your entire face is blended. [5] X Research source Matte skin creates a neutral base so your eyes and lips can stand out.

steps.title: Dab concealer under your eyes and on blemishes and blend it well.
steps.content: Dab concealer under your eyes and on blemishes and blend it well. [6] X Expert Source Katya Gudaeva Professional Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 April 2019. Pat on a few swipes of concealer to brighten up your under eyes. Add concealer over any blemishes on your skin to create an even base for the rest of your makeup. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Dust your face with translucent powder to set and mattify your look.
steps.content: Dust your face with translucent powder to set and mattify your look. Pick up some translucent powder with a stiff makeup brush or sponge. Pat it all over your face to set your foundation, paying special attention to your forehead, nose, cheeks, and chin. [8] X Research source A matte finish is super important for a Gatsby makeup look, since that was the style in the 1920s.

steps.title: Pat on some pink blush to highlight your cheekbones.
steps.content: Pat on some pink blush to highlight your cheekbones. Rub a blush brush over some light pink blush and then pat it onto the tops of your cheekbones. Blend it out a little bit so the blush doesn’t look super harsh. [9] X Research source You can add a little shimmery highlighter on top of your cheekbones, right above the blush, if you want to make them stand out more. Avoid applying shimmer on other areas of your face, though! You want to look as matte as possible.

steps.title: Fill in your brows with a matching pencil so they look thin and elongated.
steps.content: Fill in your brows with a matching pencil so they look thin and elongated. Use an eyebrow pencil to fill in your eyebrows with your natural eyebrow color. Instead of accentuating the arch of your brows, try to keep them in a semi-straight line with the tails pointed out, not downwards. [10] X Research source This style of eyebrow was popular in the 1920s when The Great Gatsby was written.

steps.title: Dab an eyeshadow primer over your eyelids.
steps.content: Dab an eyeshadow primer over your eyelids. Put a pea-sized amount of eyeshadow primer onto your lids and blend it in with your fingertips. Wait for about 2 minutes to give the primer a chance to dry. [11] X Research source Primer will keep your eyeshadow from creasing and make it last longer.

steps.title: Dust a dark mauve eyeshadow onto your eyelids with a makeup brush.
steps.content: Dust a dark mauve eyeshadow onto your eyelids with a makeup brush. Pick out a pinky-brown color, like dark mauve, to use on your eyelids. Swipe it over your lids with an eyeshadow brush to blend it well up into your crease. [12] X Research source If you don’t have mauve, you can also use green or brown eyeshadow as a base instead.

steps.title: Smudge a thick line of black eyeliner pencil at the outer edges of your lids.
steps.content: Smudge a thick line of black eyeliner pencil at the outer edges of your lids. Make a small V shape on the outside of your eyelids with a chunky eyeliner pencil. Smudge the charcoal color around a little bit to create a smokey eye effect on the outer edges of your lids. [13] X Research source The V shape doesn’t have to be perfect since you’ll be adding more eyeshadow on top of it.

steps.title: Outline and define your crease with black eyeshadow.
steps.content: Outline and define your crease with black eyeshadow. Dip a small eyeshadow brush into some dark black eyeshadow. Then, swipe it over the entire crease of your eyelid from the outer edge to the inner corner. [14] X Research source You may have to go over your crease a few times to make it stand out.

steps.title: Drag a little black eyeshadow underneath your eyes for a sultry look.
steps.content: Drag a little black eyeshadow underneath your eyes for a sultry look. Use a small eyeshadow brush to gently add some black eyeshadow underneath your waterline just below your eye. Smudge this eyeshadow out a little bit with your fingers to create more of a smokey effect. [15] X Research source Don’t put the black eyeshadow directly onto your waterline, or you could irritate your eye.

steps.title: Outline your waterline with black eyeliner, if desired.
steps.content: Outline your waterline with black eyeliner, if desired. Take a black eyeliner pencil and rub it gently onto your lower waterline. If you want to, you can also rub it onto your upper waterline to outline your entire eye. [16] X Research source Putting eyeliner on your waterline can be irritating for some people. If you don’t want to put eyeliner on your waterline, you don’t have to.

steps.title: Curl your eyelashes and apply waterproof mascara.
steps.content: Curl your eyelashes and apply waterproof mascara. Use an eyelash curling wand to clamp down on your eyelashes and hold them in a curl for about 10 seconds. Then, apply 3 to 4 coats of waterproof mascara to your upper and lower lashes to hold the curl. [17] X Research source If you want to add fake eyelashes, use natural-looking ones that don’t add a ton of volume or length.

steps.title: Outline your lips with concealer to disguise your lip's natural contours.
steps.content: Outline your lips with concealer to disguise your lip's natural contours. Think about your cupid’s bow being the point of a heart. Dip a thin, stiff makeup brush into a liquid concealer and outline your lips so that your cupid’s bow is pointy, not curved. Pat it into your skin and blend well. [18] X Research source Concealer will also stop your lip color from bleeding or smudging.

steps.title: Line your lips with pink or red liner and emphasize the cupid's bow.
steps.content: Line your lips with pink or red liner and emphasize the cupid's bow. You can choose between deep red, plum, or wine-colored lip liner, which were popular in the '20s. Line your top lip by following the lines of concealer you made with your brush. Line the rest of your top lip by following its natural lines. [19] X Research source A slightly pointed upper lip was popular in the 1920s.

steps.title: Fill in your lips with bright pink or red lipstick.
steps.content: Fill in your lips with bright pink or red lipstick. Match your lip liner to a cream lipstick color and fill in the rest of your lips with color. Choose a lipstick that won’t dry into a matte finish so that your lips look shiny. [20] X Research source

steps.title: Add some lip gloss to make your lip color more shiny, if you want.
steps.content: Add some lip gloss to make your lip color more shiny, if you want. If you are using a matte lipstick or your lip color isn’t standing out enough, apply a thin layer of clear gloss to accentuate your lip shape. [21] X Expert Source Katya Gudaeva Professional Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 11 April 2019. Keep your lip gloss with you throughout the night in case you need to reapply it. [22] X Research source
